b66447ff65774edd5a1c6539e201cf2e6b16d218 Updates in general was only done if a POI changed. This caused changes related to something other than a change in POI to be ignore. The code now "resets" the POI when such changes occur (change of ruleset for example). Ruleset selection is was not persistent. When reloading the list of rulesets for a given region, any previously selected ruleset would be reset to defaults. Also fixed several new clang warnings.
d3d7e4f73e746c8f591a55b357a630b181257abc Replace original weather info with new airmapd weather interface. It seems the icons now use dash instead of underscore. I'm simply replacing dash by underscore wholesale (to match the existing resource names) until I know better.

a2c0e0d2db6367b060f79ddd39ba5e6746f5e7a8 Deal with annoying missing params due to *_ENABLE settings
4283729f83325821738421f80ddf4da854ffd33f Change feature default values to something that will be identified as "not set". When a flight is created, features with missing values (not set) are not included. Note that all these are persistent, which may create a problem if something changes (different vehicle with large weight difference for instance). As the subsequent use of these are persistent, a question may not be asked because it's already set (the brief only asks for missing or problem values).

70d6ccb038c335ea53e56b15fe342f617155750e Update PX4 Firmware metadata Fri Jan 12 04:37:12 UTC 2018
1db0adaf58fb8b951bac290be9e6879a0ae92dd2 Fixed an issue when importing a tile set that already exists would cause an error. When an imported set has a same name, it is renamed so the name is unique. The original logic had an error and was allowing the "new" set to be added with the same name, which would cause an error. In addition, if a new tile set brings no new unique tiles, it is now ignored. Fixed an issue where the progress was based on the total number of incoming tiles but this total can change if a given tile already exists in the database (it is not added).

e0d94b4dea5a19833802a2e6b02fcfe9e1c9b28e Fixing asynchronous issue with link disconnect. I noticed that some times, the disconnect signal would get to the updateConnect button (tool bar) before the link was physically disconnected. That would cause it to count it as a still connected link and get the connect button logic out of sync. While at it, added an interface to the UDP link to return its configuration instance. That allows the LinkManager to unlink it when disconnecting it.
3fd9497c85c09b1d430cac7da85fc498cf8b6a91 Forcing no proxy for UDP connections. This came through google groups and as the change is right where I'd been working, I added it here to avoid collision.

c97c855764c1e8f881ae1f5b267f7f8e8c755f94 Can't call _socket methods from primary thread
be2780d72870213f247b885027152e7b0cf4d889 Modify TCPLinkTest for new threading model
8d3e1779dd1a6efa29541ed821e26a503b613673 Replaced expensive modulus operation with bitwise-and.
7576bdd4b38be6a6edbe223a3db21b9c6394cb52 Refactored the lost packets calculations for MAVLink. Current version was not as clear as it could be.
7be19f2bc3bb95c12e4a4b22e3b2ae76a0630bf4 Reduced size of datatypes involved with JoystickInput class. Most math and backend storage was floats anyways, so most of these changes just half the data copied during function calls without reducing precision.
bbeb00e305b2e9f797ed5571a96a9ebe504efb84 Alter UAS.cc so that it transmits MANUAL_CONTROL messages at 5Hz when no inputs have changed. Otherwise MANUAL_CONTROL messages are still sent at the regular 50Hz. This reduces transmission bandwidth from 0.9kbps when the joystick is used continuously to 0.1kbps when it's idle. To prevent possible issues from the last high-bandwidth message being lost and the system then not responding for .1s, the last messsage is double-transmit which should prevent those issues.

5dde30b7e0bf6dbc8ff655fd1b3bf9c6daeb9029 Removed constant debugging output from scanning for serial ports. Replaced with only 1 output message with the result of the first serial port scan.
4b07086fd4b7af44e2370f7ba69ecbb8b81a4f30 Fix for #647. In the logplayer, the data stream is read ahead for messages, which is used to determine the size of the output bytearrays. Previously, this wasn't done correctly resulting in non-ideal behavior. Now, the next message is scanned properly, so the only bytearrays that are emitted from QGCMAVLinkLogPlayer are MAVLink messages in their entirety. This also has the benefit of skipping invalid/corrupted messages in the log that's being played back.

84c82d976b37a534c987e1cd9db959ed342b5d39 Refactored the mission message exclusion logic. The existing logic for filtering out MISSION* messages that don't apply to this instance of QGC wasn't clear and exactly correct. This refactoring reorganizes the code to be more clear and makes it explicit when the messages should be ignored by this instance of QGC. Additionally a few more status messages are translated to be helpful to our non-English speaking devs/users.

efe8e8b2b4a16a9f27169f7d1f4059bf703a565f Corrected repository layout section of the README. Reduced it to folder descriptions and important files.
a1be8b0cc7706ebe470c974697306c4eee3e26de Updated Linux build instructions. Separated into logical steps. Made optional and required steps explicit. Added instructions for Fedora.
0a91721a09e4d73564136f105d4def0c3a1fe6e6 Improvements to libxbee compilation. XBee support can now be disabled by defining DISABLE_XBEE. Details on why XBee support is disabled are now output.
1d0f0fd8671d60c554f240a1ca484ec35323efb8 Made warning messages from qmake more explicit.
ebbb7b7ac63ae9889426f25446706bec79543986 Altered build procedure for speech synthesis. Speech synthesis support can now be disabled (DEFINES+=DISABLE_SPEECH) Speech synthesis dependencies are now checked before enabling. When support cannot be enabled, the user is now notified.
1de1547be4fb829f21d645ea7bbc28cc956488d1 Improved MAVLink dialect selection. MAVLink dialects can now be specified as a list, so multiple dialects can be compiled in simultaneously (may result in conflicts between dialects). MAVLink dialects are checked for existance before support is added. Users are notified of which dialects are used and which cannot be added and why. The README now has info about specifying MAVLink dialects.
35dca1d0d268b351051fd6e3d43224e8c46253a4 Improved MAVLink dialect selection. MAVLink dialects can now be specified as a list, so multiple dialects can be compiled in simultaneously (may result in conflicts between dialects). MAVLink dialects are checked for existance before support is added. Users are notified of which dialects are used and which cannot be added and why. The README now has info about specifying MAVLink dialects.
29ef19a687c5129d3c2ce9e78d438a4f933c9322 Updating QUpgrade build process. Now properly checks for if QUpgrade submodule has been cloned. Allows for disabled QUpgrade compilation. Altered some code so that compiling without the QUpgrade module could succeed. Updated README about QUpgrade submodule.

2f1d35c5103c454a209aa9f701d5a8a20423d9ef Merge pull request #422 from DonLakeFlyer/Mavericks_Fix
bfe8684e2b4efdbb3c01d97c6132eaa0e0b5bdcb Removed LinkInterface methods which were never being called. Updated various LinkInterface implementation classes to remove the methods. Some methods such as the ones which measure data rates or bits sent/received were implemented in only some of the implementation classes, and in some cases implemented incorrectly. If they were called, the values returned would be incorrect. Although there was some partial implementation for these I removed them as well since in all case they were never being called by any code. In checking Blame, these came across in 2010 and have remained unimplemented since them, so I figure better to clean up than leave crufty, unused, half finished stuff in.

8e533fd32b87414742f67c2d0441e24c9430539b Vastly improved the joystick documentation, removed some redundant/unnecessary code, and fixed a couple of small bugs. This code should be ready for live testing.
36060bd15e271564c06cbaf5dff856b66696974f Implementation of FrameTypeConfig completed, now reads and sets Frame Type
adbbdb45d3fd55dc662cf7677c763852cc38c790 All UI elements in the JoystickWidget window are now updated properly when switching UASes, which was the last major issue with this code. A single small bug remains involving the UI not updating the axis values when switching joysticks until the axis is moved.
8268ca2c4fd7ab89aa163eb90ea4026312d37a25 The last selected joystick is now saved and re-selected on startup.
274b20d8b4268c92d29f86983e1e1900a3657db1 Change for layout of configuration widgets, and start of implmentation of RadioCalibration Widget
9bda816e54a03f29e490850290e4e784be786af9 Have settings loaded/stored correctly for all joysticks based on their UAS type and autopilot type. Switching between UASes doesn't work right yet, however.
632ddad3ade6ba332be5e7f28b2e3ab4d416f3e4 New configuration menu setup. Placeholders for now, waiting for functionality
c23dc4d66fb43cf791e3c330b0dc40f5a53b58bd Merge branch 'quickview_textsizing'
84badf33c02fa7ba702dd3ecd0cf145a54bba38b PFD crash on start bugfix and rename to .cc
275855b936360c76456611e7fcd9fa0c79a39ab7 The default UAS.cc now lists available actions that it can be commanded. These are polled by the Joystick Configuration window for each joystick button so that they can be assigned to trigger this action. Button presses don't yet trigger these actions, nor are they stored and reloaded on UAS switch.
8f585b40a52fa197e81956f3bfb5898a7712b468 Fix for category values not being updated in QuickView properly
0f89c83865e11c136098e87c3e79ff50db83d3e9 Some comment cleanup, and fix so when closing the main window, it also closes the item select window
07c10d107049f6eb9d23afcabfc35538995ae140 QuickView selection dialog now sorts items by category and lists them in an easier to read format
55efdf8d4668df7eec218ab71c82742bafbf31a1 The settings for each joystick are loaded and saved on switch. The state of the enable joysticks checkbox is not saved yet, however, though it should really be tracked by JoystickInput so that it can sleep more when joysticks are disabled.
860e47b6ace973054b8db84859d0c1e40b4ac4ea Restored range limiting to the throttle channel. Now if the UAS can't reverse, the throttle can be set to only use the positive range of the axis (useful with auto-centering control sticks) or to use the full range (for sticks that hold position).
3a3085ad1d3f8a7062c8b8c8351bee2e312bfffb Change of Text sizing in QuickView, to allow for smoother resizing
da79b6cef62403b25dbd61c91ffe85d8b4eed170 Change for new APM2.0 logo
24af948fa30fcfdd0df43464028ab012ad65acae Merge branch 'joystick_commands' of github.com:Susurrus/qgroundcontrol into joystick_commands
9d18a986dbda5678268e7d20b8b4b253bd5675ae The joystick code now understands if a UAS can reverse or not (based on UASInterface::systemCanReverse) and scales the joystick input accordingly. This isn't ideal on auto-centering axes and so the limit-range code should be brought back as an option for the throttle channel.
b6d9f23bf83a33a297609295044d911e42fa881e The UASInterface now defines a systemCanReverse() function for indicating if the UAS is capable of commanding a reverse thrust.
f086840fba28c40119852acda548fb3a87184295 Remove range limiting for joystick axes in preparation for moving that code into UASInterface.h.
f820eefc8e286503ebb591cb82d83305a18beced Joystick axes can now be specified as being exclusively-positive in the range [0:1.0] for the throttle. This should really be a vehicle-specific setting.
f3ddb9d5c788dbd98670116f16ada9a4764bc974 The UI now updates properly for when a detected joystick is lacking either buttons or axes (as in the case of an in-built accelerometer).
4ed616a424ff3c27075a86f33dc138cfcb375c67 Fix for improperly-named slot causing runtime error.
5ee18dafb58759525de12263cd7c9e3c605ec8f7 Added an inversion checkbox for each joystick axis so they can be individually inverted or not. This will be a joystick-specific configuration and independent of the autopilot used. Also refactored the code so that the JoystickAxis objects connect directly to the JoystickInput thread for updating the backend. The JoystickWidget is now just a facilitator and doesn't do any redirecting itself.
8999151efc84e0bc709413093e33912e25ec2cb6 The button/axis/hat readings are now compared to the previous readings and signals are only emitted if they changed. The joystickChanged signal is still emitted every sample period.
47cd05eaaca3dcd384b7e156babf37a8ef62a70b The hat readings from the joystick now works correctly. Also moved some signals over to using an enum from an int type.
902f359f9363256517b483eb47bed6de232cb04d Moved the JOYSTICK_*_MAPPING enum into JoystickInput where it belongs. Also renamed some local variables.
1e5e97ad596e2bd4da2bc11aa20a0d3388dbbfcf Refactored some variables and added some documentation. Also, now the joystickChanged signal emits NaN for axes that aren't mapped, so consumers should handle this properly.
133b39f968dd1f79a0156af240c12b754f0c01d8 Styling improvements to the joystick configuration window.
d6e52a55d596239cd50bc27b66182858b0c1c784 Disable all UI for the joystick configuration when no joysticks are found.
316620fdd3aa8298360f5a50a3ed7c9364326bb2 Refactored much of the joystick interface with the largest changes being the removal of dead/unused code including broken event-based SDL reading code. Additionally the mapping code should now work, though it hasn't been tested with controller switching or a real UAS. Finally the existing settings code has been commented-out as it is not compatible with the current state of this code and needs to be able to support different joysticks based on name.
90efec1bc1502c92b01d12d512fa0fef10ae6429 The joystick settings window has now been reworked to be a fixed minimum size and dynamically scale with both the number of buttons and axes on a given joystick/controller. Mapping functionality is incomplete at this point still, though the UI exists for it.
897758782b2fd933bd55debac8c1aa407843fe20 The joystick widget now has theming capabilities. Also displays button presses properly now.
481edea88f83120d3cfb5b519e356bc47ded86bd Renamed slot in ChartPlot to match connect() calls elsewhere.
6a0c4b8f6e0332b828d94640ad9632d68df2a573 Renamed the Joystick Test menu option to Joystick Configuration to be more clear.
c532f413318a4a85186118144918f39973ee1177 The JoystickInput class now emits signals for both button press and button release events.
7908dc7d861216f8f585a8eb6e5c3243d66e7ea8 The JoystickWidget now has a parent so that it gets cleaned up when the MainWindow is closed preventing zombie-dialog syndrome.
e169b59ff28da2dbecb5de8bcbd4ae7c32d07595 The Joystick Settings window now supports selecting between multiple joysticks for control input and updates its UI accordingly. Much work is left to be done: light/dark styling, settings management, control mappings.
64d0741ee82db3d5dac2108f3f6d03c6fa66e5c6 Joystick axes can now be specified as being exclusively-positive in the range [0:1.0] for the throttle. This should really be a vehicle-specific setting.
404045527e0d567b0d865bdb0fc5b52dbef71a67 The UI now updates properly for when a detected joystick is lacking either buttons or axes (as in the case of an in-built accelerometer).
7e1e1e97909d183749f2dcdfaa938c6e4737f927 Fix for improperly-named slot causing runtime error.
90c4d504ac1f9c9cbd03aee17752538142533db8 Added an inversion checkbox for each joystick axis so they can be individually inverted or not. This will be a joystick-specific configuration and independent of the autopilot used. Also refactored the code so that the JoystickAxis objects connect directly to the JoystickInput thread for updating the backend. The JoystickWidget is now just a facilitator and doesn't do any redirecting itself.
7b5b09a27d8042a08540eaeccd9d51318bc2fe0b The button/axis/hat readings are now compared to the previous readings and signals are only emitted if they changed. The joystickChanged signal is still emitted every sample period.
c8647cc07bdac21f7e6c0a0de1bef759067a9bf0 The hat readings from the joystick now works correctly. Also moved some signals over to using an enum from an int type.
bdeb97354254b073640ac698bae287b1c5372504 Change of name for diydrones fork of QGroundControl to APM Planner 2.0, per Chris Anderson and Craig Elder
f418c2e555b7fac565670422e76e1cc25a5eb891 Addition of requestReset to LinkInterface, to allow MavLinkProtocol to detect when connected, but at the wrong baud rate, request a reset.
5b969d254cbb9ee9a851ee121cb17dfcd3e7d6da Fix for a crash involving RawStatusView
96c080fb856759b9455f853609589ce1a0d64ae1 Moved the JOYSTICK_*_MAPPING enum into JoystickInput where it belongs. Also renamed some local variables.
cff4a3b56c8287b882a3ab1883c471b32926e91e Refactored some variables and added some documentation. Also, now the joystickChanged signal emits NaN for axes that aren't mapped, so consumers should handle this properly.
ba6c9ba93b9e73be03e5f05fbc6ec364c3ab9041 Change for InfoView's QuickView text sizing, and reenabling of RawStatusView
2c9317b5db1b70cbc65f52b68d09db2160e108a0 Changed radio calibration min/max to 800/2200 for APM connected RC units
96d573bc9d8521df3bd0f6a0e5054cb598d3039e Change for an initial SeriaLink, and QGCToolBar having a selection menu next to the connect button
1f55e9c1d0b5877bd36a56edbcec73854cd69a79 Merge branch 'master' of github.com:mavlink/qgroundcontrol
c2d396db6d74bf2f8f9c8049864f8cec4122a0ce Potential fixes for ActiveQt
9a9ca548cddcb2813898d6fb23b02f4a1a9fc5e2 Fixed windows build errors.
61e63ac09aac45d05294b0e64c03c11db7af5f6e Styling improvements to the joystick configuration window.
cfffe063445c18f41d1e120d178e9e7975d8f9ca Disable all UI for the joystick configuration when no joysticks are found.
ff2c011d17c2a3d091d4aee188e72bb7ddf7b27c Refactored much of the joystick interface with the largest changes being the removal of dead/unused code including broken event-based SDL reading code. Additionally the mapping code should now work, though it hasn't been tested with controller switching or a real UAS. Finally the existing settings code has been commented-out as it is not compatible with the current state of this code and needs to be able to support different joysticks based on name.

2a42532fc9a55ce540f9ddc1f80715e4f0df267f symptom: heartbeat Hz value was always 0 cause: check for null pointer had no effect (static memory) solution: fill mavlink messages (and thus) message type with 0xff. this patch assumes that message ID 0xff is never used positiv side effect: qgroundcontrol uses 2% less cpu on my machine (eeepc)

5114ff8ea1b3cd77098a98400a87b232a9e12028 Added logging of useful values from the HEARTBEAT and SYS_STATUS messages to the realtime plotter. Removed some dead code. Added more valueChanged() signals to account for every data type. This moves the conversion over into the valueChanged receivers, which while it will require more slot-functions, makes it easier to add more code as any necessary conversion is done internally to the slot and so the signaler doesn't need to know the details. I also added some more details on the types of units expected by valueChanged().

2bb0b1e666ca2b243ff1c2995665a34ebafd686a Merge pull request #101 from Trof/offline-wplist
aa5d50438d9a4007d557825fcde693e48cb90945 Some more bugfixes and improvements for the Mission Plan widget. The "current"-checkbox in "Onboard"-waypoints can no longer be changed by clicking directly, but it is handled internally by QGC. Now there should be one and only one checked checkbox, which shows the last KNOWN "current" waypoint on MAV. The white border around an unchecked checkbox means, that the user is requesting the change of current waypoint, but QGC has not received MISSION_CURRENT message as a confirmation yet. Also,if there is no response from UAV after pushing "Read" or "Refresh", the "Onboard" list will be deleted to indicate, that there is no information available.
